scalesUsed.notes: A - B - C# - D - E - F# - G# - A
scalesUsed.application: Primary harmonic foundation for chord progressions
Lead guitar solos and melodic fills

mainProgression.description: Classic rock progression using ♭VII chord for signature AC/DC sound

sectionProgressions.description: Extended progression with ♭VII adding rock edge and harmonic interest
Same progression with full band arrangement and anthemic energy
Building section emphasizing the subdominant and ♭VII resolution

harmonicFunction: A5 (I) - Establishes strong tonic center in A major
D5 (IV) - Provides subdominant movement and harmonic departure
G5 (♭VII) - Borrowed from A minor, creates classic rock character and tension

techniques.name: Power Chords
techniques.description: Classic rock power chord progression forming the song's foundation

tips: Keep power chords tight and percussive

techniques.name: Palm Muting
techniques.description: Essential palm muting technique for tight, controlled rhythm

notes: Light palm contact with strings near bridge
Essential for Malcolm Young's rhythm style
tips: Rest palm lightly on strings near bridge pickup
Don't press too hard - should still hear pitch

techniques.name: Pentatonic Lead
techniques.description: Simple pentatonic scale runs for lead guitar sections

notes: A minor pentatonic scale (5th fret position)
Focus on note clarity over speed
tips: Use alternate picking for smoother runs

techniques.name: Rhythm Guitar
techniques.description: Driving eighth note rhythm pattern with pocket timing

tips: Play slightly behind the beat for groove
Focus on staying in the pocket
Practice with metronome at slower tempos

sections.name: Intro
sections.description: Simple A5 power chord with driving rhythm
notes: Sets the driving rhythm for the entire song
Clean A5 power chord with palm muting

sections.name: Verse
sections.description: Alternating A5 and D5 power chords

sections.name: Chorus
sections.description: Extended progression with G5 adding rock edge
notes: A5 - D5 - G5 - D5 - A5 progression
More open, driving feel than verse

sections.name: Guitar Solo
sections.description: Melodic pentatonic lead lines over chord progression
notes: A minor pentatonic scale (5th fret position)

sections.name: Bridge
sections.description: Building section with D5 - G5 - A5 progression
notes: Same rhythm approach as other sections
Sets up return to main progression

guitar.pickup: Bridge humbucker pickup for lead, both pickups for rhythm

effects.other: Pure tube amp overdrive - no pedals

beginner.title: Basic Power Chords
steps: Learn basic A5, D5, G5 power chords

intermediate.title: Song Structure & Rhythm
steps: Play full song structure with timing

advanced.title: Performance Mastery
steps: Improvise lead lines in A minor pentatonic

acdc.title: Back in Black
acdc.similarity: Similar power chord approach and rhythm style

acdc.title: Thunderstruck
acdc.similarity: AC/DC classic with more advanced techniques

acdc.title: For Those About to Rock
acdc.similarity: Similar chord progressions and AC/DC rhythm style

commonMistakes: Rushing the rhythm - stay in the pocket
Over-palm muting - should still hear note pitch
Using upstrokes - AC/DC style is all downstrokes
Playing too fast initially - master timing first
Sloppy chord changes - practice transitions slowly
practiceRoutine: Warm up with power chord exercises
metronomeWork: Start at 80 BPM for chord changes
Focus on staying slightly behind beat
Use different time signatures for variety
